# nemeton ![](reference/figures/logo.png)

> **Analyse syst√©mique de territoires forestiers selon la m√©thode
> Nemeton**

`nemeton` est un package R pour l‚Äôanalyse int√©gr√©e d‚Äô√©cosyst√®mes
forestiers √† partir de donn√©es spatiales ouvertes. Il impl√©mente la
m√©thode Nemeton pour calculer, normaliser et visualiser des
**indicateurs biophysiques multi-famille** essentiels √† la gestion
foresti√®re durable.

## ‚ú® Fonctionnalit√©s principales

- üå≥ **Syst√®me multi-famille** : 12 familles d‚Äôindicateurs (9
  impl√©ment√©es : C, B, W, A, F, L, T, R + infrastructure)
- üìä **25 sous-indicateurs** : Carbone (C1-C2), Biodiversit√© (B1-B3),
  Eau (W1-W3), Air (A1-A2), Sols (F1-F2), Paysage (L1-L2), Temporel
  (T1-T2), Risques (R1-R3) + legacy
- ‚è±Ô∏è **Analyse temporelle** : Datasets multi-p√©riodes, calcul de taux de
  changement, visualisations
- üìà **Normalisation avanc√©e** : min-max, z-score, quantiles, par
  famille, avec r√©f√©rence
- üéØ **Agr√©gation flexible** : 5 m√©thodes (moyenne, pond√©r√©e,
  g√©om√©trique, harmonique, min)
- üó∫Ô∏è **Visualisations riches** : Cartes, radar multi-famille (jusqu‚Äô√† 12
  axes), comparaisons, tendances temporelles
- üîÑ **Workflow int√©gr√©** : De la donn√©e brute aux indices composites
- üì¶ **Production-ready** : 845+ tests, \>70% coverage, 100% backward
  compatible

## üìã Pr√©requis

- R ‚â• 4.1.0
- Packages spatiaux : `sf`, `terra`, `exactextractr`
- Visualisation : `ggplot2`, `tidyr`

## üöÄ Installation

``` r
# Depuis GitHub (version d√©veloppement)
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("pobsteta/nemeton")
```

## üéØ Quick Start

### Workflow Multi-Famille v0.2.0 (Recommand√©)

``` r
library(nemeton)

# Charger le dataset de d√©monstration (136 ha, 20 parcelles foresti√®res)
data(massif_demo_units)
layers <- massif_demo_layers()

# 1. Cr√©er des indicateurs synth√©tiques multi-famille
units <- massif_demo_units[1:10, ]
units$C1 <- rnorm(10, 150, 20)  # Biomasse carbone
units$C2 <- runif(10, 0.7, 0.9) # NDVI
units$W1 <- rnorm(10, 0.8, 0.2) # R√©seau hydro
units$W2 <- runif(10, 5, 15)    # Zones humides
units$W3 <- rnorm(10, 8, 2)     # TWI

# 2. Normaliser par famille
normalized <- normalize_indicators(units, method = "minmax", by_family = TRUE)

# 3. Cr√©er indices de famille
family_scores <- create_family_index(
  normalized,
  method = "weighted",
  weights = list(
    C = c(C1 = 0.7, C2 = 0.3),
    W = c(W1 = 0.3, W2 = 0.3, W3 = 0.4)
  )
)

# 4. Visualiser profil multi-famille (v0.3.0: support 9-12 familles)
nemeton_radar(family_scores, unit_id = 1, mode = "family")

# Comparer plusieurs unit√©s (v0.3.0)
nemeton_radar(family_scores, unit_id = c(1, 2, 3), mode = "family")
```

### Workflow Classique v0.1.0 (Compatible)

``` r
# Toujours fonctionnel pour compatibilit√© arri√®re
results <- nemeton_compute(massif_demo_units, layers, indicators = "all")
normalized <- normalize_indicators(results, method = "minmax")
health <- create_composite_index(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm"),
  name = "ecosystem_health"
)
plot_indicators_map(health, indicators = "ecosystem_health", palette = "RdYlGn")
```

### Avec vos propres donn√©es

``` r
library(nemeton)
library(sf)

# 1Ô∏è‚É£ Cr√©er les unit√©s d'analyse spatiales
units <- nemeton_units(
  "parcelles.gpkg",
  metadata = list(
    site_name = "For√™t de Fontainebleau",
    year = 2024,
    source = "IGN BD For√™t v2"
  )
)

# 2Ô∏è‚É£ Cr√©er le catalogue de couches spatiales
layers <- nemeton_layers(
  rasters = list(
    biomass = "data/biomass_agb.tif",      # Biomasse a√©rienne (Mg/ha)
    dem = "data/ign_mnt_25m.tif",          # MNT 25m
    landcover = "data/oso_landcover.tif"   # Occupation du sol
  ),
  vectors = list(
    roads = "data/bdtopo_routes.gpkg",     # Routes
    water = "data/bdtopo_hydro.gpkg"       # Cours d'eau
  )
)

# 3Ô∏è‚É£ Calculer les indicateurs (avec pr√©processing automatique)
results <- nemeton_compute(
  units,
  layers,
  indicators = "all",  # Tous les indicateurs
  preprocess = TRUE    # Harmonisation CRS + crop automatique
)

# 4Ô∏è‚É£ Normaliser les valeurs (√©chelle 0-100)
normalized <- normalize_indicators(
  results,
  method = "minmax"
)

# 5Ô∏è‚É£ Cr√©er un indice de sant√© √©cosyst√©mique
health_index <- create_composite_index(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm"),
  weights = c(0.4, 0.4, 0.2),
  name = "ecosystem_health"
)

# 6Ô∏è‚É£ Visualiser sur une carte
plot_indicators_map(
  health_index,
  indicators = "ecosystem_health",
  palette = "RdYlGn",
  title = "Indice de Sant√© √âcosyst√©mique"
)

# 7Ô∏è‚É£ Sauvegarder
ggsave("ecosystem_health.png", width = 10, height = 8, dpi = 300)
```

## üì¶ Dataset de D√©monstration

Le package inclut `massif_demo`, un dataset synth√©tique repr√©sentant un
massif forestier de 136 ha avec 20 parcelles.

### Contenu

``` r
# Charger les unit√©s spatiales (parcelles)
data(massif_demo_units)
print(massif_demo_units)
# 20 parcelles foresti√®res en Lambert-93 (EPSG:2154)

# Charger les couches environnementales
layers <- massif_demo_layers()
summary(layers)
# 4 rasters : biomass, dem, landcover, species_richness
# 2 vecteurs : roads, water
```

### Caract√©ristiques

- **20 parcelles foresti√®res** (surface totale : 136 ha)
- **Projection** : Lambert-93 (EPSG:2154)
- **R√©solution rasters** : 25m
- **Donn√©es incluses** :
  - `biomass` : Biomasse a√©rienne (Mg/ha)
  - `dem` : Mod√®le Num√©rique de Terrain (m)
  - `landcover` : Occupation du sol (classes 1-5)
  - `species_richness` : Richesse sp√©cifique (nb esp√®ces)
  - `roads` : R√©seau routier (5 routes)
  - `water` : Cours d‚Äôeau (3 rivi√®res)

### Exemples d‚Äôutilisation

``` r
library(nemeton)

# 1. Analyse compl√®te
data(massif_demo_units)
layers <- massif_demo_layers()
results <- nemeton_compute(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  indicators = "all",
  forest_values = c(1, 2, 3)
)

# 2. Visualiser les indicateurs bruts
plot_indicators_map(
  results,
  indicators = c("carbon", "biodiversity", "water"),
  palette = "viridis",
  facet = TRUE,
  ncol = 3
)

# 3. Cr√©er un indice composite
normalized <- normalize_indicators(results, method = "minmax")
health <- create_composite_index(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm", "fragmentation_norm"),
  weights = c(0.3, 0.3, 0.2, 0.2),
  name = "ecosystem_health"
)

# 4. Visualiser l'indice
plot_indicators_map(
  health,
  indicators = "ecosystem_health",
  palette = "RdYlGn",
  title = "Sant√© √âcosyst√©mique - Massif Demo"
)
```

## üìö Indicateurs disponibles

### üå≤ Indicateur Carbone

Stock de carbone forestier √† partir de biomasse a√©rienne.

``` r
# Exemple avec massif_demo
data(massif_demo_units)
layers <- massif_demo_layers()
carbon <- indicator_carbon(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  biomass_layer = "biomass",
  conversion_factor = 0.47  # IPCC default
)
summary(carbon)  # Stock de carbone en Mg C/ha
```

**Donn√©es requises** : Raster de biomasse (tonnes/ha ou Mg/ha) **Source
recommand√©e** : Copernicus Biomass, GEDI, ou mod√®les locaux

### ü¶ã Indicateur Biodiversit√©

Indices de diversit√© (richesse, Shannon, Simpson).

``` r
# Exemple avec massif_demo
biodiv <- indicator_biodiversity(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  richness_layer = "species_richness",
  index = "richness"
)
summary(biodiv)  # Nombre moyen d'esp√®ces par parcelle
```

**Donn√©es requises** : Raster de richesse sp√©cifique ou indices
pr√©-calcul√©s **Source recommand√©e** : INPN, GBIF, inventaires forestiers

### üíß Indicateur Eau

R√©gulation hydrique (TWI + proximit√© cours d‚Äôeau).

``` r
# Exemple avec massif_demo
water <- indicator_water(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  dem_layer = "dem",
  water_layer = "water",
  weights = c(0.6, 0.4)
)
summary(water)  # Indice 0-1 (0 = faible, 1 = fort)
```

**Donn√©es requises** : MNT (DEM) + vecteur r√©seau hydrographique
**Source recommand√©e** : IGN RGE ALTI, BD TOPO Hydrographie

### üåø Indicateur Fragmentation

Fragmentation foresti√®re (couverture, connectivit√©).

``` r
# Exemple avec massif_demo
frag <- indicator_fragmentation(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  landcover_layer = "landcover",
  forest_values = c(1, 2, 3)  # Classes foresti√®res
)
summary(frag)  # Pourcentage de couverture foresti√®re
```

**Donn√©es requises** : Raster d‚Äôoccupation du sol **Source recommand√©e**
: OSO (Theia), Corine Land Cover

### üõ§Ô∏è Indicateur Accessibilit√©

Accessibilit√© humaine (distance routes/sentiers).

``` r
# Exemple avec massif_demo
access <- indicator_accessibility(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  roads_layer = "roads",
  invert = FALSE  # TRUE pour indice de sauvagerie
)
summary(access)  # Indice 0-1 (0 = inaccessible, 1 = tr√®s accessible)
```

**Donn√©es requises** : Vecteurs routes et sentiers **Source
recommand√©e** : BD TOPO Routes, OpenStreetMap

## üîÑ Workflow complet

### Exemple 1 : Avec massif_demo (D√©butants)

``` r
library(nemeton)

# 1Ô∏è‚É£ Charger les donn√©es de d√©monstration
data(massif_demo_units)
layers <- massif_demo_layers()

# 2Ô∏è‚É£ Calculer tous les indicateurs
results <- nemeton_compute(
  massif_demo_units,
  layers,
  indicators = "all",
  forest_values = c(1, 2, 3),  # Classes foresti√®res pour fragmentation
  progress = TRUE
)

# 3Ô∏è‚É£ Normaliser (√©chelle 0-100)
normalized <- normalize_indicators(
  results,
  method = "minmax"
)

# 4Ô∏è‚É£ Cr√©er des indices composites
ecosystem_health <- create_composite_index(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm"),
  weights = c(0.4, 0.4, 0.2),
  name = "ecosystem_health"
)

wilderness_index <- normalized %>%
  invert_indicator(indicators = "accessibility_norm", suffix = "_wilderness") %>%
  create_composite_index(
    indicators = c("biodiversity_norm", "accessibility_norm_wilderness"),
    weights = c(0.6, 0.4),
    name = "wilderness"
  )

# 5Ô∏è‚É£ Visualiser
plot_indicators_map(
  ecosystem_health,
  indicators = "ecosystem_health",
  palette = "RdYlGn",
  title = "Sant√© √âcosyst√©mique"
)

plot_indicators_map(
  wilderness_index,
  indicators = "wilderness",
  palette = "Greens",
  title = "Indice de Sauvagerie"
)
```

### Exemple 2 : Avec vos propres donn√©es

``` r
library(nemeton)
library(sf)

# 1Ô∏è‚É£ Charger vos parcelles foresti√®res
parcelles <- st_read("mes_parcelles.gpkg")

# Cr√©er l'objet nemeton_units
units <- nemeton_units(
  parcelles,
  id_col = "id_parcelle",
  metadata = list(
    site_name = "Mon site d'√©tude",
    year = 2024,
    source = "Inventaire terrain + IGN"
  )
)

# Cataloguer les couches spatiales
layers <- nemeton_layers(
  rasters = list(
    biomass = "biomass.tif",
    dem = "mnt.tif",
    landcover = "occupation_sol.tif",
    species_richness = "richesse_specifique.tif"
  ),
  vectors = list(
    roads = "routes.gpkg",
    water = "cours_eau.gpkg"
  )
)
```

### 2. Calcul des indicateurs

``` r
# Calculer tous les indicateurs
results <- nemeton_compute(
  units,
  layers,
  indicators = "all",
  preprocess = TRUE,     # Harmonisation CRS automatique
  progress = TRUE,       # Afficher progression
  forest_values = c(1, 2, 3)  # Pour fragmentation
)

# Ou s√©lectionner des indicateurs sp√©cifiques
results <- nemeton_compute(
  units,
  layers,
  indicators = c("carbon", "biodiversity", "water")
)
```

### 3. Normalisation

``` r
# M√©thode 1 : Min-max (0-100, par d√©faut)
normalized <- normalize_indicators(
  results,
  indicators = c("carbon", "biodiversity", "water"),
  method = "minmax"
)

# M√©thode 2 : Z-score (standardisation)
normalized_z <- normalize_indicators(
  results,
  method = "zscore"
)

# M√©thode 3 : Quantiles (robuste aux outliers)
normalized_q <- normalize_indicators(
  results,
  method = "quantile"
)

# Normalisation avec donn√©es de r√©f√©rence
new_normalized <- normalize_indicators(
  new_data,
  reference_data = baseline_data,  # Utilise min/max de baseline
  method = "minmax"
)
```

### 4. Indices composites

``` r
# Indice de sant√© √©cosyst√©mique (pond√©ration √©gale)
ecosystem <- create_composite_index(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm"),
  name = "ecosystem_health"
)

# Indice de conservation (pond√©ration personnalis√©e)
conservation <- create_composite_index(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm"),
  weights = c(0.3, 0.5, 0.2),  # Priorit√© biodiversit√©
  name = "conservation_value"
)

# Indice de sauvagerie (inverser accessibilit√©)
wilderness <- normalized %>%
  invert_indicator(
    indicators = "accessibility_norm",
    suffix = "_wilderness"
  ) %>%
  create_composite_index(
    indicators = c("biodiversity_norm", "accessibility_norm_wilderness"),
    weights = c(0.6, 0.4),
    name = "wilderness_index"
  )

# Approche conservatrice (facteur limitant) - v0.3.0
limiting <- create_family_index(
  normalized,
  method = "min"  # Prend la valeur minimale par famille
)
```

### 5. Visualisations

``` r
# Carte simple - Un indicateur
plot_indicators_map(
  results,
  indicators = "carbon",
  palette = "Greens",
  title = "Stock de Carbone Forestier"
)

# Cartes multiples - Facettes
plot_indicators_map(
  normalized,
  indicators = c("carbon_norm", "biodiversity_norm", "water_norm"),
  palette = "viridis",
  facet = TRUE,
  ncol = 3,
  title = "Indicateurs Normalis√©s"
)

# Indice composite avec breaks personnalis√©s
plot_indicators_map(
  ecosystem,
  indicators = "ecosystem_health",
  palette = "RdYlGn",
  breaks = c(0, 25, 50, 75, 100),
  labels = c("Faible", "Moyen-Faible", "Moyen-Haut", "Haut", "Tr√®s Haut"),
  title = "Sant√© √âcosyst√©mique"
)

# Comparaison de sc√©narios
plot_comparison_map(
  current_state,
  future_scenario,
  indicator = "ecosystem_health",
  labels = c("√âtat actuel (2024)", "Sc√©nario 2050"),
  palette = "RdYlGn"
)

# Carte de changement
plot_difference_map(
  baseline,
  scenario,
  indicator = "carbon",
  type = "relative",  # Pourcentage de changement
  title = "√âvolution du Stock de Carbone (%)"
)

# Graphique radar - Profil multi-dimensionnel
nemeton_radar(
  normalized,
  unit_id = "P01",
  title = "Profil √âcosyst√©mique - Parcelle P01"
)

# Radar moyen de toutes les unit√©s
nemeton_radar(
  normalized,
  title = "Profil Moyen du Massif"
)
```

## üé® Palettes de couleurs

``` r
# Viridis (d√©faut) - Perceptuellement uniforme, daltonien-friendly
plot_indicators_map(data, indicators = "carbon", palette = "viridis")

# ColorBrewer s√©quentielles
plot_indicators_map(data, indicators = "carbon", palette = "Greens")
plot_indicators_map(data, indicators = "water", palette = "Blues")
plot_indicators_map(data, indicators = "biodiversity", palette = "YlOrRd")

# ColorBrewer divergente (pour indices composites)
plot_indicators_map(data, indicators = "ecosystem_health", palette = "RdYlGn")
```

## üìä Donn√©es d‚Äôentr√©e recommand√©es

| Indicateur        | Couche requise      | Format              | Source recommand√©e       |
|-------------------|---------------------|---------------------|--------------------------|
| **Carbone**       | Biomasse a√©rienne   | Raster (Mg/ha)      | Copernicus Biomass, GEDI |
| **Biodiversit√©**  | Richesse sp√©cifique | Raster (nb esp√®ces) | INPN, GBIF, inventaires  |
| **Eau**           | MNT + Hydrographie  | Raster + Vecteur    | IGN RGE ALTI + BD TOPO   |
| **Fragmentation** | Occupation du sol   | Raster (classes)    | OSO (Theia), CLC         |
| **Accessibilit√©** | Routes + Sentiers   | Vecteur (lignes)    | BD TOPO, OpenStreetMap   |

### Projections recommand√©es

- **France m√©tropolitaine** : Lambert-93 (EPSG:2154)
- **Autres** : Projections locales appropri√©es

Le package g√®re automatiquement la reprojection si `preprocess = TRUE`.

## üîß Configuration avanc√©e

### M√©tadonn√©es et tra√ßabilit√©

``` r
units <- nemeton_units(
  parcelles,
  metadata = list(
    site_name = "Massif des Vosges",
    year = 2024,
    source = "IGN BD For√™t v2 + Inventaires terrain",
    description = "Parcelles de gestion foresti√®re durable",
    contact = "gestionnaire@foret.fr"
  )
)

# Acc√©der aux m√©tadonn√©es
meta <- attr(units, "metadata")
meta$crs           # Syst√®me de coordonn√©es
meta$n_units       # Nombre d'unit√©s
meta$area_total    # Surface totale
meta$created_at    # Date de cr√©ation
```

### Pr√©processing manuel

``` r
# Sans pr√©processing automatique
results <- nemeton_compute(units, layers, preprocess = FALSE)

# Ou pr√©processing manuel
layers_harmonized <- harmonize_crs(layers, target_crs = st_crs(units))
layers_cropped <- crop_to_units(layers_harmonized, units, buffer = 100)
layers_masked <- mask_to_units(layers_cropped, units)

results <- nemeton_compute(units, layers_masked, preprocess = FALSE)
```

### Gestion des erreurs

``` r
# Si un indicateur √©choue, les autres continuent
results <- nemeton_compute(
  units,
  layers,
  indicators = "all",
  forest_values = c(1, 2, 3)  # Requis pour fragmentation
)
# Warning: Indicator 'water' calculation failed
# > Setting 'water' to NA

# V√©rifier les indicateurs calcul√©s
meta <- attr(results, "metadata")
meta$indicators_computed  # Indicateurs r√©ussis
```

## üìñ Documentation

### Vignettes (Guides Complets)

``` r
# Introduction et workflows de base
vignette("getting-started", package = "nemeton")

# Analyse multi-p√©riode et d√©tection de changements
vignette("temporal-analysis", package = "nemeton")

# R√©f√©rentiel complet des 12 familles d'indicateurs
vignette("indicator-families", package = "nemeton")

# Support bilingue fran√ßais/anglais
vignette("internationalization", package = "nemeton")
```

### R√©f√©rence des Fonctions

- **Manuel complet** :
  [`?nemeton`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton-package.md)
  ou [`help(package = "nemeton")`](https://rdrr.io/pkg/nemeton/man)
- **Fonctions principales** :
  - [`?nemeton_compute`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_compute.md) -
    Calculer les indicateurs
  - [`?nemeton_temporal`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_temporal.md) -
    Analyse multi-p√©riode (v0.2.0)
  - [`?create_family_index`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/create_family_index.md) -
    Indices de famille (v0.2.0)
  - [`?normalize_indicators`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/normalize_indicators.md) -
    Normaliser les valeurs
  - [`?create_composite_index`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/create_composite_index.md) -
    Cr√©er des indices composites
  - [`?nemeton_radar`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_radar.md) -
    Radar multi-famille (v0.2.0)
  - [`?plot_indicators_map`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_indicators_map.md) -
    Visualiser sur carte

## ü§ù Contribution

Les contributions sont bienvenues ! Pour contribuer :

1.  Fork le projet
2.  Cr√©er une branche (`git checkout -b feature/amelioration`)
3.  Commiter les changements (`git commit -m 'Ajout fonctionnalit√©'`)
4.  Push vers la branche (`git push origin feature/amelioration`)
5.  Ouvrir une Pull Request

### D√©veloppement

``` r
# Cloner le d√©p√¥t
git clone https://github.com/pobsteta/nemeton.git
cd nemeton

# Installer les d√©pendances de d√©veloppement
remotes::install_deps(dependencies = TRUE)

# Charger le package
devtools::load_all()

# Lancer les tests
devtools::test()

# V√©rifier le package
devtools::check()
```

## üìÑ Licence

Ce projet est sous licence MIT. Voir le fichier
[LICENSE](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/LICENSE) pour plus de
d√©tails.

## üìö Citation

Si vous utilisez `nemeton` dans vos travaux de recherche, veuillez citer
:

    Obst√©tar, P. (2026). nemeton: Systemic Forest Analysis Using the Nemeton Method.
    R package version 0.3.0. https://github.com/pobsteta/nemeton

BibTeX :

``` bibtex
@Manual{nemeton2026,
  title = {nemeton: Systemic Forest Analysis Using the Nemeton Method},
  author = {Pascal Obst√©tar},
  year = {2026},
  note = {R package version 0.3.0},
  url = {https://github.com/pobsteta/nemeton},
}
```

### Nouveaut√©s v0.3.0 (2026)

- üåø **4 nouvelles familles** : Biodiversit√© (B), R√©silience (R),
  Temporel (T), Air & Microclimat (A)
- üìä **10 nouveaux indicateurs** : B1-B3 (protection, structure,
  connectivit√©), R1-R3 (incendie, temp√™te, s√©cheresse), T1-T2
  (anciennet√©, changement), A1-A2 (couverture, qualit√© air)
- üé® **Radar 9-axes** : Visualisation radar extensible jusqu‚Äô√† 12
  familles, mode comparaison multi-unit√©s
- üìà **Agr√©gation min** : Nouvelle m√©thode d‚Äôagr√©gation conservatrice
  (facteur limitant)
- üìà **845+ tests** : +28% vs v0.2.0 (661 tests), 100% backward
  compatible
- üîÑ **Infrastructure √©tendue** : Support complet des 9 familles dans
  normalisation, agr√©gation, visualisation

### Nouveaut√©s v0.2.0 (2025)

- üéØ **Syst√®me multi-famille** : 12 familles d‚Äôindicateurs (5
  impl√©ment√©es)
- ‚è±Ô∏è **Analyse temporelle** : Datasets multi-p√©riodes, taux de
  changement
- üìä **10 indicateurs biophysiques** : C1-C2, W1-W3, F1-F2, L1-L2
- üìà **661 tests** : +195% vs v0.1.0 (225 tests)
- üîÑ **100% r√©tro-compatible** : Tous workflows v0.1.0 fonctionnent
- üìö **2 nouvelles vignettes** : temporal-analysis, indicator-families

## üôè Remerciements

- **IGN** pour les donn√©es g√©ographiques de r√©f√©rence
- **Theia** pour les donn√©es OSO d‚Äôoccupation du sol
- **Copernicus** pour les donn√©es de biomasse
- Communaut√©s **sf**, **terra**, et **ggplot2** pour les outils spatiaux

- [Documentation compl√®te](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/) (√†
  venir)
- [Issues et suggestions](https://github.com/pobsteta/nemeton/issues)
- [Discussions](https://github.com/pobsteta/nemeton/discussions)

Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

# Package index

## Data Management / Gestion des donn√©es

Create and manage spatial units and layers / Cr√©er et g√©rer les unit√©s
spatiales et les couches

- [`nemeton_units()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_units.md)
  : Create nemeton_units object
- [`nemeton_layers()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_layers.md)
  : Create nemeton_layers object
- [`massif_demo_units`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/massif_demo_units.md)
  : Massif Demo - Example Forest Dataset
- [`massif_demo_layers()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/massif_demo_layers.md)
  : Load Massif Demo Spatial Layers

## Core Workflow / Workflow principal

Main functions for indicator calculation / Fonctions principales pour le
calcul d‚Äôindicateurs

- [`nemeton_compute()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_compute.md)
  : Calculate Nemeton indicators for spatial units
- [`list_indicators()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/list_indicators.md)
  : List available indicators

## Family C: Carbon & Vitality / Famille C : Carbone & Vitalit√©

Carbon storage and vegetation vitality indicators / Indicateurs de
stockage de carbone et de vitalit√© de la v√©g√©tation

- [`indicator_carbon()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_carbon.md)
  : Calculate carbon stock indicator
- [`indicator_carbon_biomass()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_carbon_biomass.md)
  : Carbon Stock via Biomass and Allometric Models (C1)
- [`indicator_carbon_ndvi()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_carbon_ndvi.md)
  : NDVI Mean and Trend Analysis (C2)

## Family W: Water Regulation / Famille W : R√©gulation de l‚Äôeau

Hydrological regulation and water-related indicators / Indicateurs de
r√©gulation hydrologique et relatifs √† l‚Äôeau

- [`indicator_water()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_water.md)
  : Calculate water regulation indicator
- [`indicator_water_network()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_water_network.md)
  : Hydrographic Network Density (W1)
- [`indicator_water_wetlands()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_water_wetlands.md)
  : Wetland Coverage (W2)
- [`indicator_water_twi()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_water_twi.md)
  : Topographic Wetness Index (W3)

## Family F: Soil Fertility / Famille F : Fertilit√© des sols

Soil quality and erosion risk indicators / Indicateurs de qualit√© du sol
et de risque d‚Äô√©rosion

- [`indicator_soil_fertility()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_soil_fertility.md)
  : Soil Fertility Class (F1)
- [`indicator_soil_erosion()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_soil_erosion.md)
  : Erosion Risk Index (F2)

## Family L: Landscape Quality / Famille L : Qualit√© du paysage

Landscape structure and connectivity indicators / Indicateurs de
structure du paysage et de connectivit√©

- [`indicator_landscape_fragmentation()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_landscape_fragmentation.md)
  : Landscape Fragmentation (L1)
- [`indicator_landscape_edge()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_landscape_edge.md)
  : Edge-to-Area Ratio (L2)

## Family B: Biodiversity / Famille B : Biodiversit√© (v0.3.0)

Biodiversity protection, structure, and connectivity / Protection,
diversit√© structurelle et connectivit√© √©cologique

- [`indicator_biodiversity_protection()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_biodiversity_protection.md)
  : Calculate Protected Area Coverage (B1)
- [`indicator_biodiversity_structure()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_biodiversity_structure.md)
  : Calculate Structural Diversity (B2)
- [`indicator_biodiversity_connectivity()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_biodiversity_connectivity.md)
  : Calculate Ecological Connectivity (B3)

## Family R: Risk & Resilience / Famille R : Risques & R√©silience (v0.3.0)

Fire, storm, and drought vulnerability / Vuln√©rabilit√© aux incendies,
temp√™tes et s√©cheresse

- [`indicator_risk_fire()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_risk_fire.md)
  : Calculate Fire Risk Index (R1)
- [`indicator_risk_storm()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_risk_storm.md)
  : Calculate Storm Vulnerability Index (R2)
- [`indicator_risk_drought()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_risk_drought.md)
  : Calculate Drought Stress Index (R3)

## Family T: Temporal Dynamics / Famille T : Dynamique temporelle (v0.3.0)

Forest age and land cover change / Anciennet√© des peuplements et
changements d‚Äôoccupation

- [`indicator_temporal_age()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_temporal_age.md)
  : Calculate Stand Age Index (T1)
- [`indicator_temporal_change()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_temporal_change.md)
  : Calculate Land Cover Change Rate Index (T2)

## Family A: Air & Microclimate / Famille A : Air & Microclimat (v0.3.0)

Tree coverage and air quality / Couverture arbor√©e et qualit√© de l‚Äôair

- [`indicator_air_coverage()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_air_coverage.md)
  : Calculate Tree Coverage Buffer Index (A1)
- [`indicator_air_quality()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_air_quality.md)
  : Calculate Air Quality Index (A2)

## Other Indicators (v0.1.0) / Autres indicateurs (v0.1.0)

Biodiversity, fragmentation, accessibility indicators / Indicateurs de
biodiversit√©, fragmentation, accessibilit√©

- [`indicator_biodiversity()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_biodiversity.md)
  : Calculate biodiversity indicator
- [`indicator_fragmentation()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_fragmentation.md)
  : Calculate forest fragmentation indicator
- [`indicator_accessibility()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicator_accessibility.md)
  : Calculate accessibility indicator

## Temporal Analysis / Analyse temporelle

Multi-period analysis and change detection / Analyse multi-p√©riodes et
d√©tection de changements

- [`nemeton_temporal()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_temporal.md)
  : Create Multi-Period Temporal Dataset
- [`calculate_change_rate()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/calculate_change_rate.md)
  : Calculate Change Rates Between Periods

## Cross-Family Analysis / Analyse Crois√©e Inter-Familles (v0.3.0)

Correlation analysis and multi-criteria hotspot identification / Analyse
de corr√©lations et identification de hotspots multi-crit√®res

- [`compute_family_correlations()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/compute_family_correlations.md)
  : Compute Correlation Matrix Between Family Indices
- [`identify_hotspots()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/identify_hotspots.md)
  : Identify Multi-Criteria Hotspots
- [`plot_correlation_matrix()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_correlation_matrix.md)
  : Plot Correlation Matrix Heatmap

## Normalization & Aggregation / Normalisation & Agr√©gation

Transform and combine indicators / Transformer et combiner les
indicateurs

- [`normalize_indicators()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/normalize_indicators.md)
  : Normalize indicator values
- [`create_composite_index()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/create_composite_index.md)
  : Create composite index from multiple indicators
- [`create_family_index()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/create_family_index.md)
  : Create Family Composite Indices
- [`invert_indicator()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/invert_indicator.md)
  : Invert indicator values

## Visualization / Visualisation

Maps and charts for results / Cartes et graphiques pour les r√©sultats

- [`plot_indicators_map()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_indicators_map.md)
  : Create thematic maps for indicators
- [`plot_comparison_map()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_comparison_map.md)
  : Create comparison map (before/after or scenarios)
- [`plot_difference_map()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_difference_map.md)
  : Create difference map (change visualization)
- [`nemeton_radar()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_radar.md)
  : Create radar chart for indicator profile
- [`plot_temporal_trend()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_temporal_trend.md)
  : Plot Temporal Trend (Time-Series)
- [`plot_temporal_heatmap()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/plot_temporal_heatmap.md)
  : Plot Temporal Heatmap

## Internationalization / Internationalisation

Multi-language support / Support multi-langues

- [`nemeton_set_language()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/nemeton_set_language.md)
  : Set language manually

## S3 Methods / M√©thodes S3

Print and summary methods for nemeton objects / M√©thodes print et
summary pour les objets nemeton

- [`print(`*`<nemeton_units>`*`)`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/print.nemeton_units.md)
  : Print method for nemeton_units
- [`print(`*`<nemeton_layers>`*`)`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/print.nemeton_layers.md)
  : Print method for nemeton_layers
- [`print(`*`<nemeton_temporal>`*`)`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/print.nemeton_temporal.md)
  : Print Method for nemeton_temporal Objects
- [`summary(`*`<nemeton_units>`*`)`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/summary.nemeton_units.md)
  : Summary method for nemeton_units
- [`summary(`*`<nemeton_layers>`*`)`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/summary.nemeton_layers.md)
  : Summary method for nemeton_layers
- [`summary(`*`<nemeton_temporal>`*`)`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/summary.nemeton_temporal.md)
  : Summary Method for nemeton_temporal Objects

## Internal Functions / Fonctions internes

Internal helper functions (for developers) / Fonctions d‚Äôaide internes
(pour d√©veloppeurs)

- [`detect_indicator_family()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/detect_indicator_family.md)
  : Detect Indicator Family from Name
- [`get_family_name()`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/get_family_name.md)
  : Get Family Name from Code
- [`family-system`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/family-system.md)
  : Multi-Family Indicator System
- [`indicators-families`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/indicators-families.md)
  : Indicator Family Functions - v0.2.0 Extension
- [`temporal`](https://pobsteta.github.io/nemeton/reference/temporal.md)
  : Multi-Temporal Analysis Infrastructure
